moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 f6: This move I hadn't expect creates a "gap" in black's defence and blocks his queen
moves.5... g5: Now his king is very exposed to attacks
moves.6. d3: I want to use my bishop
moves.7. Nxg5: This move will result in mate. It seems as I sacrifice a knight but I don't
moves.7... fxg5: He captures this ensures my victory a little bit more
moves.8. Bxg8: Exhanging my bishop for his knight and undoing the defence of h5
moves.8... Rxg8 9. Qxh5+: Because black no longer defends h5 the white queen can give checkon h5
moves.9... Ke7 10. Bxg5+: He has to capture my bisop with his rook or he loses his queen
